page.title: 18WILDLIFE IN DEVIZES.
page.content: The best places to see wildlife in Devizes are the old railway line and the canal.Along the railway,foxes have their earths and badgers use it as a passageway on foraging expeditions.The canal supports a variety of insects, amphibians and waterbirds. Devizes is the centre of the Wiltshire Trust for Nature Conservation,who have their offices there,together with a shop selling many items related to wildlife.The Trust was formed in 1962 and today manages over 40 reserves.Its aims are to safeguard important wildlife sites,to advise on conservation and to increase public awareness of it.It depends upon voluntary help and the support and enthusiasm of its members.Junior members belong to the 'Watch' group and special talks and outings are arranged for them within the County.
